Plan Signed between DPRK and China
articles.content:
Plan Signed between DPRK and China 
    Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- A Juche 95-96 (2006-2007) plan for scientific and technological exchanges between the DPRK Bureau of Earthquake and the Chinese State Seismological Bureau was signed in Beijing on Nov. 25. 
 Present at the signing ceremony were the members of the delegation of the bureau headed by its Director Kang Sin Dong from the DPRK and the director of the bureau and officials concerned from China.

articles.title: Mayor of Sankt-Petersburg of Russia Here
articles.content:
Mayor of Sankt-Petersburg of Russia Here
    Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- Valentina Matvienko, mayor of Sankt-Petersburg of the Russian Federation, and her party arrived here Monday.
 They were greeted at the airport by Kim Yong Jae, vice-minister of Foreign Trade who is chairman of the Committee for Promotion of International Trade of the DPRK, officials concerned, Andrei Gennadiyevich Karlov, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, and embassy officials.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Meets Mayor of Sankt-Petersburg of Russia
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Meets Mayor of Sankt-Petersburg of Russia
    Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, met and had a friendly conversation with Valentina Matvienko, mayor of Sankt-Petersburg of the Russian Federation, and her party who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday.
 On hand were Rim Kyong Man, minister of Foreign Trade, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, officials concerned and Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Andrei Gennadiyevich Karlov.

articles.title: Talks Held between DPRK Minister of Foreign Trade and Mayor of Sankt-Petersburg of Russia
articles.content:
Talks Held between DPRK Minister of Foreign Trade and Mayor of Sankt-Petersburg of Russia
    Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- Talks between Rim Kyong Man, minister of Foreign Trade of the DPRK, and Valentina Matvienko, mayor of Sankt-Petersburg of the Russian Federation, were held at the People's Palace of Culture on Monday.
 At the talks both sides discussed the issues of boosting the cooperative relations between the DPRK and Sankt-Petersburg of the Russian Federation in foreign trade and reached a consensus of views on them. 
 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were Vice-Minister of Foreign Trade Kim Yong Jae who is chairman of the Korean Committee for the Promotion of International Trade and officials concerned and from the Russian the party of the mayor and Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Andrei Gennadiyevich Karlov.    
 Meanwhile, business talks and inter-sector talks were held between economic and trade officials of the DPRK and businessmen of Sankt-Petersburg of the Russian Federation.

articles.title: Hyangdam Efficacious for Hepatitis Developed
articles.content:
Hyangdam Efficacious for Hepatitis Developed
    Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- The Branch Academy of Biology under the State Academy of Sciences of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has succeeded in making Hyangdam (tablets) efficacious for hepatitis.
 According to Choe Yong Il, a doctor of liver department of the hospital attached to Pyongyang University of Medicine, its clinical test to hundreds of hepatitis cases for three years shows that it is far better than existing world-famous anti-hepatitis medicines such as Liv-52 and Phyonjahwan.
 The tablets also make it possible to keep such digestive system viscera as stomach, gall, pancreas, small intestines in good function. 
 Hyangdam, which is made with pig gall and various kinds of Koryo medicines, is potent for increasing bile acid, detoxicating liver and protecting liver. It won a patent of the DPRK in Juche 93 (2004).    
 The demand for it is ever increasing in China, Japan and other countries of Asia.

Photo Exhibition Introducing Sankt-Petersburg Held
articles.content:
Photo Exhibition Introducing Sankt-Petersburg Held
    Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- A photo exhibition introducing Sankt-Petersburg of the Russian Federation was held at the People's Palace of Culture on Monday. 
 The exhibition was attended by Rim Kyong Man, minister of Foreign Trade, Kim Yong Jae, vice-minister of Foreign Trade who is chairman of the Korean Committee for the Promotion of International Trade, officials concerned, Valentina Matvienko, mayor of Sankt-Petersburg of the Russian Federation, and her party and Andrei Gennadiyevich Karlov, Russian ambassador to the DPRK.
 They went round the photos, being briefed on the city by the mayor.
